body.p:
Louisville Ky. July 5th 1865 --
To His Excellency.
Thomas E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky.
Louisville City Court
Governor.

On the of June 1865 I was upon a confessed judgment fined five Hundred dollars for dealing a game of "Faro" in the city of Louisville. I am really unable to pay the whole sum and my desire is that you will remit me that portion which goes to the Commonwealth. I appeal solely to your Executive clemency.

Yours with much respect,
Joseph. Croxton
We the undersigned join earnestly in the above prayer of the Petitioner and respectfully ask the remission sought.

W K Thomas
Pat Dillon M, C, C, L
Geo W. Johnston,
W. G. Reasor City Atto.
Phil Tomppert Jr C. C. C. L.
D. L. Bligh
I Respectfully request Gov Bramlette to remit the fine mentioned in the petition

W. G Reasor
City Atto.
Jas P Harbeson City Judge

Louisville City Ct
vs
Joseph Croxton
$500,
dealing faro
11 Sept 1865
Sent for fee 30 Aug
